intro: Hemiboea kaiyangensis, commonly known as the Kaiyang hemiboea, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant is evergreen, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
